      public FoxTail​(FoxHead foxHead)
      Constructor
      Parameters:
      foxHead - Reference to the FoxHead object which the tail is related to.

  • Method Details

    • calculateCoord

      public Coordinate calculateCoord​(Coordinate coordHead)
      Calculates the coordinate in which the fox's tail must be in relation to the coordinate of the fox's head.
      Parameters:
      coordHead - Fox Head's coordinate.
      Returns:
      The coordinate in which the fox's tail must be.

    • getHeadEndCoordinate

      private Coordinate getHeadEndCoordinate​(Coordinate tailDestination, int sizeBoard)
      Parameters:
      tailDestination - Coordinate of the destination of the fox's tail
      sizeBoard - How big the board is.
      Returns:
      Coordinate object of the destination of the head that is related to the fox's tail.

    • isValidMove

      public boolean isValidMove​(Coordinate destination, Level level)
      Description copied from interface: Movable
      Checks if the move is valid according to the game's rules.
      Parameters:
      destination - The object representing the destination coordinate of the movable piece.
      level - The level on which this move is taking place.
      Returns:
      true if the move is valid, false if parameters are invalid or the move is invalid.

    • move

      public boolean move​(Coordinate destination, Level level)
      Moves the piece from the move's starting coordinate to the move's ending coordinate according to the game's rules.. In this case, this method really moves the head, which will move the tail.
      Parameters:
      destination - The object representing the destination coordinate of the movable piece.
      level - The level on which this move is taking place.
      Returns:
      true if the move was successful, false if parameters are invalid or the move was unsuccessful. It also returns "false" if there doesn't exist a reference to the head.
